  sgcool_label_text: This book contains the account of the first embassy sent by the Dutch East India Company (VOC) from 1655 to 1657 to the Emperor of China
 as chronicled by Johan Nieuhof. It is one of the earliest European accounts of Chinese culture
 society
 geography
 botany and zoology
 and includes a detailed description of the East Indies. The text
 based on Nieuhof\u0027s eyewitness account
 is supplemented with numerous illustrations.

metadata.context_1: Dutch East India Company's first embassy to China
metadata.sgcool_label_text: This book contains the account of the first embassy sent by the Dutch East India Company (VOC) from 1655 to 1657 to the Emperor of China, as chronicled by Johan Nieuhof. It is one of the earliest European accounts of Chinese culture, society, geography, botany and zoology, and includes a detailed description of the East Indies. The text, based on Nieuhof's eyewitness account, is supplemented with numerous illustrations.
